title: Persepolis
summary: The ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire, known for its monumental staircases and bas-reliefs.
facts: Founded by Darius I around 518 BCE.
Symbol of imperial unity across diverse nations.

title: Sheikh Lotfollah Mosque
summary: A masterpiece of Safavid art, noted for its turquoise dome and exquisite interior tilework.
facts: Built by architect Mohammad Reza Isfahani.
Unique for lacking minarets; served royal family.
Famous for color shifts from sunrise to sunset.

title: Golestan Palace
summary: The royal Qajar complex blending Persian and European styles.
facts: Registered as UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2013.
Used for royal coronations and diplomacy.

title: Windcatchers of Yazd
summary: Traditional Iranian air-conditioning structures that cool buildings using natural ventilation.
facts: World's tallest windcatcher is at Dowlatabad Garden (33m).
UNESCO-listed as part of Historic City of Yazd.

title: Karim Khan Citadel
summary: A blend of residential palace and military fortress built by Karim Khan Zand.
facts: Corner towers are slightly leaning for defensive visibility.
Served as royal court, prison, and museum.
